intro: Podochilus spathulatus, commonly known as the broad-leafed orchid, is a flowering plant belonging to the Orchidaceae family. It is native to Southeast Asia and is characterized by its broad, lance-shaped leaves and showy, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte or terrestrial herb, often found in humid, shaded environments. Its flowers are usually pale yellow to greenish-white, with a distinctive spatulate lip. Podochilus spathulatus is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and is relatively easy to cultivate under suitable conditions.
